text:
Want to add to the previous message:

It would be pleasant to speak to you in person. Definitely, one day I'll make it, even just to say thank you for your mentoring, time and experience. :slightly_smiling_face:

Thank you for the compliment- I try my best.  It's incredible to hear praise about your work. That keeps me move forward and believe, that I'm doing something right.

Thank you for telling about Pi plugin. The only one I found is Pi Square. I've checked it out. Apparently, it's a complex of plugins that help to work on animation and assets using Unreal and Maya. Handy thing (cos it can be a pain in the ass to transfer between these two).
Currently, I'm using Animbot. A great thing without doubts. It can do a lot. It used to be free as it was on the beta for more than a year. Now it's finally released. Without speaking too much, here is all possibilities in short animations. It's easier to show, rather than list them all.

Just scroll down (every option listed):
<http://www.animbot.ca/tooltips/>

150 ways to Animate faster in Maya
Same thing, but in a video (very fast paced):
<https://animbot.ca/home/>

attachments.title: animBot
attachments.text: The Coolest and Most Powerful Toolset for Maya Animators.

text:
We didn't have any performance tasks so far. And as far as I know, we won't have any. However, performance is on my tutorial list.
I want to try to work on more stylised animation. And I will.
The reason I'm following the current path (anatomically-correct animation) is my belief, that before you run, you need to learn how to walk.

The same approach, for instance, is used in caricatures. It's essentials to learn how to draw anatomically-correct and realistic faces before you start drawing caricatures.
I may be wrong, but this is how I see it. (If I'm, please let me know. As I continually restructure knowledge inside my head. Moreover, what is relevant today may be obsolete tomorrow)

As you said - be open and ready. I totally agree with that! So well told!

About astrology - if you trust me your date of birth I can say much more. I know it's very impolite to ask how old is a lady. So I won't :smile: All that's needed is the day and a month. Like 7 of August for example.
WOW so close! It's the 6th Aug! :smile: (best day of the yeeearrr)

attachments.title: August 6th  Zodiac - Astrology Zodiac Signs
attachments.text: Warm emotions form the intense inner world of Leos born on August 6th, as if their primal goal is to express their creativity and their childish dream.

text: Don't take it too seriously. But, will the horoscope coincide with reality ? :leo:
that's really nice to read though, isn't it?! I'm definitely a deep thinker, i love reading about personality types!
To not embarrass you (I know it wouldn't embarrass you anyway), I didn't read the description. Glanced the first few proposals and that's all.
I hope it was fun at least :slightly_smiling_face:

Can I ask you please about a cover letter? I'm building my file with required documents in it (reference, cover letter, cv and showreel) for placement/internship.

What should I include in it? I know that it has to be composed individually for each company. But I'm trying to understand what are the key positions I have to highlight in this letter.

:relaxed:Thank you !
